channel.title: RSS feed of Custom Solvers 2.0
channel.description: Relevant news about my public online activity like customsolvers.com/varocarbas.com or open source projects.

item.title: Code of the customsolvers.com RSS generator released
item.description: New repository in my GitHub account including the PHP code of the custom app generating the RSS feeds of customsolvers.com.

item.title: I have started working on a new application generating RSS-feeds from random web pages
item.description:
I am already working on a new piece of software generating RSS feeds (i.e., properly-formatted XML files) via parsing the HTML code of random web pages with a compatible-with-this-format structure (e.g., social-media-like site where users post on a regular basis).
I will be relying on Perl and releasing it as open source.

item.title: Improvements in the RSS feed of the web domain ranking of varocarbas.com
item.description:
From now on and additionally to the top 1000 positions, that feed will also include the following ranges: 2501-5000 and 5001-10000.
Note that this RSS feed is fully synchronised with the corresponding database, whose tables are currently being updated every 3 days.

item.title: New QuickSearch adapters for various programming languages
item.description:
Although QuickSearch is still in a quite preliminary stage (not sure yet when version 1 will be ready), I have released additional adapters in various programming languages. My main motivation has been to help potential clients understand my flexibility on the programming language front.
At the moment, the following languages are supported: C++, C#, Go, Java, JavaScript (Node.js), Perl, PHP, Python, Ruby, Rust, VBA (Microsoft Excel) and VB.NET.

item.title: New article about NumberParser in codeproject.com
item.description: I wrote a detailed article about the original .NET/C# version of NumberParser in CodeProject.

item.title: I start to actively look for clients/work
item.description:
After having spent a relevant amount of time during the last quite a few months on having ready a descriptive enough public online presence (= my shop window), I have started to actively look for good clients/work.
My expectations are very clear and I am willing to be as patient as required. So, I hope that will be able to find/be found by the kind of people and conditions which I want.

item.title: QuickSearch 0.5 released
item.description:
Finally, I decided to release a preliminary beta version of QuickSearch with restricted functionalities. It is still quite far away from the proper verson I have in mind, but already gives a quite good idea about the main advantages of this approach: quick (searches/SELECT queries) and portable (no installation required).
I will release v.1 as soon as I can, but without unnecessarily rushing things up.

item.title: New article about UnitParser in codeproject.com
item.description: I wrote an article about UnitParser in CodeProject. Although it is about the .NET/C# version, most of these ideas are also applicable to the Java version.

item.title: Iteration 4 of the varocarbas.com web domain ranking waiting for QuickSearch 1.0
item.description:
As far as things are going reasonably well on the retrieval-information front, I will better wait for QuickSearch 1.0 to be ready before moving to the next iteration.
Note that the transition between iterations is a quite aggressive process which takes relatively long time, which will be presumably reduced thanks to QuickSearch.
